intro: Stylogyne pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Stylogyne pauciflora grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in swampy or seasonally flooded habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
